div.head: CHAP. XVI.
1 Dauid in distrust of merites, and hatred of Idolatry, flyeth to God for preseruation. 5 He sheweth the hope of his calling, of the resurrection, and life euerlasting.
div.ab: [Michtam of Dauid.] Preserue me, O God: for in thee doe I put my trust.
O my soule, thou hast sayd vnto the Lord, Thou art my Lord: my goodnes extendeth not to thee: Psal. 50. 10. Iob. 22. 2. & 35.7.
But to the Saints, that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.
Their sorrowes shalbe multiplied, that hasten after another God: their drinke offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take vp their names into my lippes. Or, giue gifts to another.
The Lord is the portion of mine inheritance, and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot. Lam.3. 24. Deut.32.9. , Heb. of my part.
The lines are fallen vnto mee in pleasant places; yea, I haue a goodly heritage.
I will blesse the Lord, who hath giuen me counsell: my reines also instruct me in the night seasons.
I haue set the Lord alwaies before me: because hee is at my right hand, I shall not be moued. Actes 2. 25.
Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory reioyceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope. Heb. dwell confidently.
For thou wilt not leaue my soule in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine holy one to see corruption. Act 2.31. and 13. 35.
Thou wilt shewe me the path of life: in thy presence is fulnesse of ioy, at thy right hand there are pleasures for euermore.
